meanings.definition: A network of protein filaments within a cell that helps maintain its shape and enables cellular movement.
meanings.sent1: The cytoskeletons provide structure and support to the cell.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study cytoskeletons to understand how cells move.
meanings.sent3: The cytoskeletons in the cell had a dance party when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The cytoskeletons are like the scaffolding of a building, holding everything together.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the cytoskeletons look like a bustling city with roads and bridges.

meanings.definition: The cytoskeletons of eukaryotic cells are composed of microfilaments, intermediate filaments, and microtubules.
meanings.sent1: Eukaryotic cells rely on cytoskeletons for structure and movement.
meanings.sent2: The cytoskeletons in eukaryotic cells are like a complex highway system.
meanings.sent3: The cytoskeletons in the cell threw a party to celebrate their diversity.
meanings.sent4: The cytoskeletons are the architects of the cell, designing its shape and function.
meanings.sent5: The cytoskeletons work together like a well-oiled machine to keep the cell functioning smoothly.
